message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DM, cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with the design and construction of self-synchronizing codes, which are typically studied in the information theory (cs.IT) and coding theory (cs.DM) communities. The use of combinatorial designs and sets is also a common theme in coding theory and discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The paper also discusses the impact of noise on the performance of self-synchronizing codes, which is a topic in cryptography (cs.CR) and signal processing (cs.SI). Finally, the paper presents constructions for self-synchronizing codes with high information rates, which is a topic in networking and communication (cs.NI).
